pull.title: document return value of networkhashps for getmininginfo RPC endpoint
pull.body: It looks like this value isn't documented in the RPC help. If it would be helpful, we could be even more specific and mention that it uses the default trailing 120 blocks parameter to calculate the hashrate.

events.body:
ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8461/commits/205eb350fd312ee0cf8dde9b0db0418799d2fbd9

As you are touching the helptext, can you please align "errors" and "chain" helptexts by adding two spaces before "(string)"?

```
  "errors": "..."          (string) Current errors
  "networkhashps": nnn,      (numeric) The network hashes per second
  "pooledtx": n              (numeric) The size of the mem pool
  "testnet": true|false      (boolean) If using testnet or not
  "chain": "xxxx",         (string) current network name as defined in BIP70 (main, test, regtest)
```
ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8461/commits/205eb350fd312ee0cf8dde9b0db0418799d2fbd9 agree with @paveljanik about the PR related nits.

events.message: document return value of networkhashps for getmininginfo RPC endpoint

events.body: Updated to align "chain" and "errors" output with rest of help text.
Backport needed, I guess. (all the way back to 0.9.x, but we don't maintain that far back)

@luke-jr According to current https://bitcoincore.org/en/lifecycle/ 0.11 only receives critical security fixes and this is only a documentation fix. (Though, I am not against backports for 0.12 and 0.13)
